note: Poverty data is expressed in [international-$](#dod:int_dollar_abbreviation) at 2017 prices. Depending on the country and year, it relates to income measured after taxes and benefits, or to consumption, [per capita](#dod:per-capita).
title: Share in poverty vs. life expectancy
subtitle:
The poverty line of $3.65 per day is set by the World Bank to be representative of the definitions of poverty adopted in
lower-middle-income countries. Life expectancy is measured as the average number of years a newborn would live if age-specific mortality rates in the current year were to stay the same throughout its life.
